page.title: 07DOMESTIC ANIMAL OWNERS
page.content: Most people we interviewed have an animal of some kind. Most{household {pets}are dogs and cats but others are rabbits, guinea pigs, budgie, goats and one donkey. A typical{dairy farm}in this area has 75{Fresian}cows and keeps lambs in the summer. One{beef farm}has 100 animals: -{Aberdeen Angus, Charolais, Hereford {and Simmentals.}They also have{3 {ponies - a Shetland, a Highland and a {Welsh pony.}There is a{riding school in this area with horses and ponies. The local{laird}rents out his fields for{sheep grazing}but also has a large flock of his own mainly{Blackface}but with some{Jacob sheep}too. The shearers who contract to shear the sheep come from the Falkland Islands. There is a boarding{kennels}in Banchory-Devenick where the owner also breeds dogs.
